title: The Echo Protocol
story_summary: Halden's voice echoes across Stenograd, warning of disaster as old backup systems clash with new rules. Chaos spreads at district borders. Facing crisis, engineers, Council, and citizens unite to stop the feedback loops. Together, they restore balance, forging an uneasy peace shaped by Halden's last plan.

official.headline: Halden Message Sounds
official.anchor_line: A citywide broadcast shares Marek Halden's last advisory, urging careful alignment for the public good.
official.contextual_reframing: Stenograd's transparent communication ensures citizens receive timely guidance from all governance layers.

official.headline: Order Amid Confusion
official.anchor_line: District borders and services adjust as backup city systems briefly diverge, maintaining public order.
official.contextual_reframing: Adaptive protocols demonstrate Stenograd's resilience and the power of collective adherence to efficient rule.

official.headline: System Harmony Restored
official.anchor_line: Unified BCI logic brings renewed stability and local voice as integration resumes across districts.
official.contextual_reframing: Collaboration between Council, experts, and citizens secures a balanced and forward-looking Stenograd for all.

underground.headline: Halden Speaks From The Grave
underground.anchor_line: Halden's ghostly warning hijacks every speaker  -  system crisis or last act of sabotage?
underground.contextual_reframing: What wasn't fixed in life comes back screaming in death. Who really controls the silence in Stenograd?

underground.headline: Locked Out And Lost
underground.anchor_line: Border chaos and double penalties  -  residents stranded as systems glitch and rules clash.
underground.contextual_reframing: So much for seamless control. When the machines fight, we pay  -  mobility, jobs, even food, all held hostage.

underground.headline: Council Just Survives
underground.anchor_line: Engineers scramble, citizens forced to 'help' decode Halden's final logic  -  peace or managed surrender?
underground.contextual_reframing: They call it restored order. We call it forced compromise. Halden's death shows the human cost of machine-run power.
